channel.title: [Pi] Stackable Items [Pi]
channel.description: Hey guys, so I have a problem with quite a bit of items I have. A lot of items I don't want to be stackable, are, like some weapons, rune essence, some armors, and idk why they are stackable. The section where stackable items are added is in a file named "stackable.dat" and I have only added one item in there. What could my problem be?

item.title: [Pi] Stackable Items [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @u_loose u loose
item.description:
@u_loose wrote:

Go to item.java

Then search.

ItemStackable[counter] = false;

Say for example you wanted claws stackable you would do

ItemStackable[14484] = true;

To make it not stackable you would do

ItemStackable[14484] = false;

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Stackable Items [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

So I should just try and hardcode the stackable items, or what should I do?

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Stackable Items [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

b00mz1029:

There is literately only one item ID in the stackable.dat

That’s probably your issue. Something/someone removed all the data, which imo, was stupid because most PI’s have stackable data for up to revision 508 at least.

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Stackable Items [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

There is literately only one item ID in the stackable.dat

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Stackable Items [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

The stackable.dat is full of items already that you didn’t add that say true or false. You can A) edit the stackable.dat again and make the items that you don’t want stackable not stackable and hope it fixes. Or B) hardcode it into your java files that some items are not stackable. A is cleaner and more efficient, but doesn’t always work. B) is worse but is almost guaranteed to work.

Read full topic
